Name: Harp
Description: A wooden harp. The instrument has a wooden belly, probably covered with parchment which was attached through pairs of holes along the edge of the sound box at intervals of 7.5 cm. There is a wooden bar along the middle of the sound box, notched at intervals of 3.8, 7, 10, 12.6 and 15.5 cm to take strings. This bar is bound at the end to a short cross-bar. The neck is formed by a long curved bar, with 5 pegs behind to fix strings.
